isis.stitle: Side Mount Cooling Package - RE Bus - REMOVE AND INSTALL PROCEDURES - HYDRAULIC FAN DRIVE MOTOR

step1.para: Unlatch and open the rear compartment service doors, left-side door, and rear door.
Place a suitable container under the lower hydraulic hose to catch the hydraulic oil from the system.
Remove P-clips and wire ties as needed from the lower hydraulic hose ( Figure 8, Item 2).
Disconnect the lower hydraulic hose from the hydraulic pump and position lower hydraulic hose into the container for draining ( Figure 8).
Remove six bolts and washers from the radiator fan and hydraulic fan drive motor hub. Position the radiator fan in the radiator shroud and against the radiator.

item.para: Tag and mark hoses before removal to ensure proper installation.
Cap and plug all hoses upon removal to stop leakage and prevent contamination.

step1.para: Remove P-clips and wire ties as needed from the pilot hose.
Disconnect pilot hose from the hydraulic reservoir.
Disconnect solenoid electrical connector from the hydraulic fan drive motor.
Disconnect two hydraulic hoses from the hydraulic fan drive motor. Relocate hoses out of the way.
Support the hydraulic fan drive motor and remove two bolts and nuts from the hydraulic fan drive motor and spider cage.
Remove the hydraulic fan drive motor from the spider cage.
If the hydraulic fan drive motor is being replaced, follow these instructions to disassemble the hydraulic fan drive motor:

item.para: Remove the hub mount nut from the hydraulic fan drive motor.
Using an appropriate puller, remove the hub from the hydraulic fan drive motor.
Remove spacer plate from front of hydraulic fan drive motor.
Remove nut from bottom of fan drive motor solenoid and slide fan drive motor solenoid off mount shaft ( Figure 14, Items 2, 3, and 4).
Remove the mount shaft from the hydraulic fan drive motor ( Figure 14, Items 1 and 2).
Remove pilot hose from the hydraulic fan drive motor.
Note the location of two fittings and remove two fittings from the hydraulic fan drive motor.

step1.para: If the hydraulic pump is being replaced, follow these instructions to assemble the hydraulic pump:

item.para: Install two fittings on the hydraulic fan drive motor as noted during removal procedures ( Figure 18, Items 3 and 4).
Install pilot hose on the hydraulic fan drive motor ( Figure 18, Items 3 and 5).
Inspect O-ring on mount shaft for damage. Replace O-ring as needed.
Install the mount shaft on the hydraulic fan drive motor ( Figure 14, Items 1 and 2).
Position the fan drive motor solenoid on the mount shaft and install nut ( Figure 14, Items 2, 3, and 4). Torque nut to 4 to 5 lbf-ft (5 to 7 N•m).
Install the spacer plate on front of the hydraulic fan drive motor ( Figure 18, Items 2 and 3).
Install the hub on the hydraulic fan drive motor and secure with the hub mount nut ( Figure 18, Items 1, 3 and 6). Torque nut to 220 to 240 lbf-ft (298 to 325 N•m).

step1.para: Align the hydraulic fan drive motor on the spider cage and secure with two bolts and nuts ( Figure 17). Torque nut to 80 to 100 lbf-ft (108 to 136 N•m).

caution.para: Some hydraulic hoses and fittings in the hydraulic system are equipped with O-rings to seal the hydraulic hoses. Inspect all O-rings prior to installation and replace as needed.

note.para: Be sure to remove all caps and plugs that were installed during the removal procedures before installing hydraulic hoses.

step1.para: Connect two hydraulic hoses to the hydraulic fan drive motor ( Figure 17, Items 3 and 5).
Connect solenoid electrical connector to the hydraulic fan drive motor ( Figure 17, Items 3 and 4).
Install the pilot hose to the hydraulic reservoir ( Figure 16).
Install the radiator fan on the hydraulic fan drive motor hub and secure with six bolts and washers ( Figure 15). Torque nut to 30 to 38 lbf-ft (41 to 52 N•m).
Install P-clips and wire ties as needed on all hydraulic hoses.
Connect the lower hydraulic hose on the hydraulic pump ( Figure 8).
Install P-clips and wire ties on the lower hydraulic hose as needed ( Figure 8, Item 2).
Fill the hydraulic system.
Close and latch the rear compartment service door.
